title: Khmer Rouge Sayings of Angkar Q1

content.description:
“1. Long live the revolutionary Khmer Rouge, utterly wise and clear-sighted and ever glorious!
2. Long live the correct and extremely clear-sighted Communist Party of Cambodia!
3. Down with American imperialists and their supporters!
4. Report everything to the Khmer Rouge!
5. Secretly observe the slightest deeds and gestures of everyone around you!
6. The Khmer Rouge has as many eyes as a pineapple.
7. The Khmer Rouge is the mother and father of all young children, as well as all adolescent boys and girls.
8. Hands off the people’s property! Not a single grain of rice, a single chili pepper, a single needle!
9. Better to arrest ten innocent people by mistake than free a single guilty person.
10. He who protests is an enemy; he who opposes is a corpse.”
Slogans of the Khmer Rouge, the governing communist party of Cambodia from 1975 to 1979. The party ordered the forcible relocation of all urban populations onto agricultural communes and was responsible for 2.2 million deaths.
content.question: The slogans best illustrate which of the following actions of twentieth-century communist governments?

choices.label: The use of subterfuge to undermine and discredit democratically elected governments
The adoption of repressive policies in order to impose one-party rule
The adoption of electronic surveillance technologies to suppress internal dissent

content.answer: The adoption of repressive policies in order to impose one-party rule
